node.title: Tennant Creek residents endure scorching heat during lockdown without air conditioning
node.description: A Tennant Creek woman and her family are sweltering in almost 40C heat in lockdown after their only air conditioner broke down. A heat expert says their situation is just one case of people suffering from poor housing conditions in the remote NT, made worse by the COVID pandemic.
node.content:
["A Tennant Creek woman and public housing resident whose\u00a0only air conditioner broke the day before the town's COVID-19\u00a0lockdown\u00a0began has been forced to endure days of temperatures approaching\u00a040C as she waits for it to be fixed.", "\"I feel angry, I feel tired\u00a0and I sleep most of the time even though I'm sweating\u00a0because I am tired,\" Valda Shannon said.\u00a0", "Lockdowns in Tennant Creek and the remote community of Ali Curung were extended again\u00a0on Wednesday, until 5pm today.", "Northern Territory\u00a0Acting Chief Minister Nicole Manison said the extension was\u00a0to give authorities more time to process\u00a0423 COVID\u00a0tests taken from Tennant Creek and 230 from Ali Curung\u00a0and to drive up low vaccination rates in both communities \u2014\u00a0with\u00a0full vaccination coverage at just\u00a074 per cent in Tennant Creek and about\u00a034 per cent in Ali Curung.", "For Ms Shannon, a Warlpiri and Warumungu woman, the direction means another day of sweltering conditions.", "She said she\u00a0first reported her\u00a0broken air conditioner to the NT's Department of Housing\u00a0around 8:30am on Friday.\u00a0", "Since then, she said she has spoken to several housing and welfare workers who have told her she's\u00a0\"on their list\".", "More than four days later, she's still waiting for a response.", "", "
Ms Shannon said\u00a0her broken air conditioner was blowing hot air and making loud noises.(Supplied: Valda Shannon)
", "Adding to her concerns is overcrowding.\u00a0", "As\u00a0well as\u00a0living with her son, daughter and two children, Ms Shannon regularly cares for her brother's children from the house next door.\u00a0", "\"We keep the kids between the two houses and work together to not let them out of the two houses,\" she said.", "\"That really tires me out.\"", "Speaking at yesterday's COVID press conference,\u00a0NT Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker said police were aware some\u00a0residents in lockdown were facing issues related to public housing and air conditioning.", "\"I'm sure public housing tenants are well aware of the process for them to report repairs and maintenance,\" he said.", "\"We strongly encourage people to do that as soon as the fault presents itself.\"", "Late on Wednesday, a\u00a0Department of Territory Families, Housing and Communities spokeswoman said the body was aware of the air conditioner fault\u00a0at Ms Shannon's home\u00a0and had scheduled\u00a0an \"urgent maintenance request\" to resolve it.", "The spokeswoman said the request would be completed within four days.", "
'You actually start to cook': Heat expert
", "Simon Quilty, an ANU\u00a0heat and health researcher based in Alice Springs, said some of the homes in remote parts of the NT\u00a0were so poorly insulated that it could feel \"substantially hotter on the inside than the outside\".", "\"Some of these homes can reach 50C, if not more,\" he said.\u00a0", "He said sweltering inside one of these homes without air conditioning was \"incredibly dangerous\".", "\"Once your core body temperature goes above 42C, you're in the vicinity of severe heat stroke,\"\u00a0 he said.\u00a0", "\"You actually start to cook from the inside and you'll die.\"\u00a0", "", "
Ms Shannon said her\u00a0home in Tennant Creek can become unbearably hot.(Supplied: Valda Shannon)
", "Dr Quilty said NT authorities must consider the extreme risk of air conditioning and power failures during lockdowns in remote communities.", "\"What I see as the main problem with virus outbreaks in remote communities is not the virus itself, which will affect all humans equally, but the housing baseline which is so appallingly poor,\" he said.\u00a0", "
Alice Springs, Barkly region mandates see residents mask up
", "As well as the lockdown extensions, Ms\u00a0Manison also announced on Wednesday the introduction of a 48-hour\u00a0mask mandate for Alice Springs and a 24-hour extension of a mask mandate already in place for the Barkly region.", "Under the mandates, masks must be worn in indoor public settings at all times, including in shops, cafes and restaurants, in workplaces and on public transport.\u00a0", "Alice Springs resident Kathy\u00a0was wearing a mask while shopping in the\u00a0town's CBD on Wednesday\u00a0before she even knew\u00a0the mask mandate was in effect.\u00a0", "She admitted that wearing a mask out and about\u00a0was an inconvenience.", "\"I'm sick of masks, honestly,\" she said.", "\"You can't breathe properly, and when you put your glasses down, they fog\u00a0up as well sometimes.\"", "", "
Kathy thinks\u00a0masks are a good defence against the virus.(ABC News: Samantha Jonscher)
", "But despite that, Kathy said wearing a mask made her feel safer when out in public, and ultimately it was\u00a0\"better to be safe than sorry\".", "\"[People] are coming in from communities\u00a0that have this virus there, and with this new [variant]\u00a0coming in, you don't know who's got it,\" she said.", "\"So I reckon, if you're in the shopping centres and in town, put your mask on, just wear it.\""]
